title: LATEST: White Sulphur Springs shooting investigation
content:
WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS - A shooting that happened during the late morning hours on Monday, Nov. 3, 2014 is under investigation by the Lewisburg Detachment of the West Virginia State Police. A woman and a child were shot outside a home on Tuckahoe Road in White Sulphur Springs. The child is a 4-year-old boy. The woman has been identified as the boy's mother, 26-year-old Effie Harth.
Anthony William Griffith, 19, was arrested and charged with Wanton Endangerment. Troopers said that the circumstances of the shooting are being investigated. A witness said that the entire incident was an accident that happened during target practice. Griffith told troopers that he was carrying an AK-47 out for target practice when the shooting
happened. Investigators
said that according to witnesses Griffith had threatened the people he lives with just a week before. Griffith was being held in the Southern Regional Jail on a $15,000 bond. Officials said that he made bail and has been released.
